summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 18, 2019. It details routine operational issues like staff shortages, equipment malfunctions, inmate counts, and leave usage. It notably lists an inmate on suicide watch with a companion and inmate Burnett at a local hospice, but does not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, including staff shortages leading to vacated posts, a control center door malfunction, inmate admissions and releases, and an inmate on suicide watch with a companion.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This is a routine daily activity report from the MCC New York dated July 19, 2019, covering the previous day's activities.
The report notes an inmate on suicide watch with an inmate companion, and inmate Burnett (#76254-054) at a local hospice under USMS guard.
Staff shortages were reported, causing correctional posts in the SHU and other units to be vacated.
The document lists new admissions (Arrera, Hussett, Russell, Taveras) and one release (Hunt) from the facility.
Jeffrey Epstein is not mentioned by name in this specific document, which appears to be a standard operational log.
